summary: This appears to be an internal email or note regarding an investigation into financial accounts and trust payments connected to Jeffrey Epstein. It discusses Deutsche Bank accounts, a trust account with beneficiaries including Ghislaine Maxwell, and mentions a co-conspirator from the Florida case. The note seeks information on account summaries, assets, and payment recipients.

persons.name: Andrew Stemmer
persons.role: Head of Litigation for the Americas at Deutsche Bank
persons.context: He is the point of contact at Deutsche Bank for information regarding accounts and the trust relationship with Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Luella Rabuyo
persons.context: She is identified as married to a recipient of payments from the Epstein trust and was accused as a co-conspirator in the Florida case.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: She is listed as a beneficiary receiving payments from a trust account connected to Jeffrey Epstein.

connections.description: Both are listed as recipients of payments from the same trust account connected to Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Attempts to close Epstein-related accounts
events.description: Movement in 2019 looks like attempts to close out accounts at Deutsche Bank connected to Jeffrey Epstein.

keyFacts: The document references a trust account with beneficiaries including Ghislaine Maxwell and a person married to Luella Rabuyo, who was accused as a co-conspirator in the Florida Epstein case.
It states the relationship with Deutsche Bank 'largely terminated several months ago' and there were attempts to close accounts in 2019.
It notes a total of 65 accounts (60 closed) at Deutsche Bank connected to the subject of the inquiry, seeking a summary of total assets and payment destinations.
